capsules_submitted.utterance: You know, I've always been fascinated by Harry's story. He's truly the boy who lived, and it's incredible to think about what he went through at Hogwarts. I mean, can you imagine being famous in the wizarding world from birth just because of your parents' deaths? It's a lot to handle, especially when you're still trying to figure out who you are and where you fit in. But Harry's bravery and selflessness have always inspired me, and I think that's what makes his story so compelling.

You know, I've always been fascinated by Harry's story. He's like a symbol of hope for many people, especially in the wizarding world. I mean, who wouldn't want to be "the boy who lived" after all? It's an incredible feeling to have that kind of power and responsibility on your shoulders.

But what really draws me to Harry is his humility and willingness to put others before himself. He's not just a hero, he's a true friend and a loyal companion. And let's be honest, his story has inspired countless people around the world.
